00053 //
00054 // Abstract socket interface
00055 //
00056 class FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY socket_t { 
00057   public: 
00058     bool              read(void* buf, size_t size) { 
00059         return read(buf, size, size) == (int)size;
00060     }
00061     virtual int       read(void* buf, size_t min_size, size_t max_size, time_t timeout = WAIT_FOREVER) = 0;
00062     virtual bool      write(void const* buf, size_t size, time_t timeout = WAIT_FOREVER) = 0;
00063 
00064     virtual bool      is_ok() = 0; 
00065     virtual void      get_error_text(char* buf, size_t buf_size) = 0;
00066 
00067     //
00068     // This method is called by server to accept client connection
00069     //
00070     virtual socket_t* accept() = 0;
00071 
00072     //
00073     // Cancel accept operation and close socket
00074     //
00075     virtual bool      cancel_accept() = 0;
00076 
00077     //
00078     // Shutdown socket: prohibite write and read operations on socket
00079     //
00080     virtual bool      shutdown() = 0;
00081 
00082     //
00083     // Close socket
00084     //
00085     virtual bool      close() = 0;
00086 
00087     //
00088     // Get socket peer name.
00089     // name is created using new char[]. If perr name can not be obtained NULL
00090     // is returned and errcode is set.
00091     //
00092     virtual char*     get_peer_name() = 0;
00093 
00094     //
00095     // Create client socket connected to local or global server socket
00096     //
00097     enum socket_domain { 
00098         sock_any_domain,   // domain is chosen automatically
00099         sock_local_domain, // local domain (i.e. Unix domain socket) 
00100         sock_global_domain // global domain (i.e. INET sockets) 
00101     };
00102 
00103     static socket_t*  connect(char const* address, 
00104                               socket_domain domain = sock_any_domain, 
00105                               int max_attempts = DEFAULT_CONNECT_MAX_ATTEMPTS,
00106                               time_t timeout = DEFAULT_RECONNECT_TIMEOUT);
00107     
00108     //
00109     // Create local domain socket
00110     //
00111     static socket_t*  create_local(char const* address,
00112                                    int listen_queue_size = 
00113                                        DEFAULT_LISTEN_QUEUE_SIZE);
00114 
00115     //
00116     // Create global domain socket 
00117     //
00118     static socket_t*  create_global(char const* address,
00119                                    int listen_queue_size = 
00120                                        DEFAULT_LISTEN_QUEUE_SIZE);
00121 
00122     virtual socket_handle_t get_handle() = 0;
00123 
00124     virtual ~socket_t() {} 
00125     socket_t() { state = ss_close; }
00126 
00127   protected:
00128     enum { ss_open, ss_shutdown, ss_close } state;
00129 };
